quote: It was so fun, please keep this race. I don't know if I'm biased since I like the East Coast, but this course is just perfection.

We started with the guys, so it was a big group and pretty chill until the first long climb, where it exploded. I was a little worried because I wasn't sure if my legs were good, but I warmed up and I was able to get with a really good group of men. We stuck together for almost the entire race.
I also want to highlight that anger and hate directed to a person or an event do not accomplish anything. At the current state, race organizers are in a very difficult position...
Absolutely brutal 130 mile and 13,000ft gravel race with lots of technical singletrack.

I had an unpleasant crash whilst riding my gravel bike over the weekend that included a concussion and being knocked out for several minutes. Unfortunately, my injuries will prevent me from riding at the Belgian Waffle Ride North Carolina race...
Leans pretty dang hard towards the road side
The course's decisive climb with about 35 miles remaining
Well-marked and abundant traffic control personnel on the course, plus police and official vehicle escorts
